result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice--Final Notice
Criminal Case Settlement
with elements
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 1:20pm [mo]
Defendant Samuel J. Martin in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court finds on this record, that Mr. Martin is a repeater and is subject to the increased penalties as set forth in the complaint
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, to be served consecutive to any sentence in being
--1 day credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443,  to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 5/6/16 and on the 6th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court determines that Mr. Martin has previously provided a DNA sample, and therefore does not order another sample be taken
recess: 1:59pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 01:15 pm

Defendant's Notice of Hearing for the 4/5/16 Plea/Sentencing Hearing

Mailed to: C/O Jefferson County Jail
Returned: R.T.S.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 01:00 pm

Case called at 1:41pm [mo]
[Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Samuel J. Martin appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Martin will continue to be represented by Atty. Huebner


Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court reinstates the signature bond previously set
recess:1:50am--reconvene:1:55pm ((for scheduling))
The Court announces plea/sentencing date
The Court directs Mr. Martin to appear at least 15 minutes early to meet with his attorney
recess:1:56pm

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 4/5/16 at 1:00pm

Attorney Karl E Huebner in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Huebner indicates that he has had no recent contact with Mr. Martin

The Court issues a bench warrant, body only

On Motion of the State, the Court finds bond to be in default, and orders bond to be forfeited.

Case called at 2:34pm [mo]
Defendant Samuel J. Martin in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Atty. Huebner raises concerns about bond conditions, re: no contact.
ADA Shock requests a later date to address the motion.
The Court declines the Defense's request to hear the motion today; the bond is to remain as fixed.
recess: 2:43

Cases 15CM83 and 15CM407 called together at 2:01pm [mo]
Defendant Marilyn L Mihai in court.   
Defendant Samuel Martin in court. 
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court gives both Defendants their right to counsel
The Court gives constructive waiver of counsel warnings to both Defendants 

As to Case 15CM407(Martin)
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Martin. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Defendant Samuel J. Martin in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.
The Court inquires of Mr. Martin's current address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions:
